page.title: International reactions to the 2011 Egyptian revolution

rev.diff:
Line 73: Line 73:
{{quote box|width=216px|quote="Violence will not address the grievances of the Egyptian people, and suppressing ideas never succeeds in making them go away.... Around the world governments have an obligation to respond to their citizens.... All governments must maintain power through consent, not coercion. That is the single standard by which the people of Egypt will achieve the future they deserve."|source=â Barack Obama<ref>{{cite web|author=Werner, Erica|url=http://wokv.com/common/ap/2011/01/29/D9L1UHTG0.html |title=Obama Admonishes Egypt's Mubarak on Protests |publisher=''[[Associated Press]]'' (via ''[[WOKV]]'') |date=undated (copyright 2011) |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hJYBPPuG4Y1vq7XMe3NnsL7yOqRQ?docId=e5469a82800b40e498667d555837548f |title=Obama Calls for Restraint, Reform in Egypt |publisher=''[[Associated Press]]'' (via ''[[Google News]]'') |date=30 January 2011 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref><ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/index.php?pid=88942&st=&st1=|title=Remarks on the Situation in Egypt|publisher=John T. Woolley and Gerhard Peters, The American Presidency Project [online]|date=28 January 2011|accessdate= 29 January 2011}}</ref>}}
{{quote box|width=216px|quote="Violence will not address the grievances of the Egyptian people, and suppressing ideas never succeeds in making them go away.... Around the world governments have an obligation to respond to their citizens.... All governments must maintain power through consent, not coercion. That is the single standard by which the people of Egypt will achieve the future they deserve."|source=â Barack Obama<ref>{{cite web|author=Werner, Erica|url=http://wokv.com/common/ap/2011/01/29/D9L1UHTG0.html |title=Obama Admonishes Egypt's Mubarak on Protests |publisher=''[[Associated Press]]'' (via ''[[WOKV]]'') |date=undated (copyright 2011) |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|author=[[Staff writer]]|url=http://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5hJYBPPuG4Y1vq7XMe3NnsL7yOqRQ?docId=e5469a82800b40e498667d555837548f |title=Obama Calls for Restraint, Reform in Egypt |publisher=''[[Associated Press]]'' (via ''[[Google News]]'') |date=30 January 2011 |accessdate=2 February 2011}}</ref><ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/ws/index.php?pid=88942&st=&st1=|title=Remarks on the Situation in Egypt|publisher=John T. Woolley and Gerhard Peters, The American Presidency Project [online]|date=28 January 2011|accessdate= 29 January 2011}}</ref>}}
* {{flag|Canada}} â [[Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister]] [[Lawrence Cannon]] said that Egypt remains an [[Canada-Egypt relations|important partner]] for Canada and urged "the Egyptian government to ensure full freedom of political expression for its citizens." He said the Canadian government "continues to stand by the people of Egypt as they demand democratic reforms and respect for human rights. We urge the Government of Egypt to begin an immediate transition toward serious democratic reform."<ref>(2 February 2011). [http://www.international.gc.ca/media/aff/news-communiques/2011/044.aspx?lang=eng "Minister Cannon Condemns Violence in Egypt"]. Retrieved 2 February 2011.</ref>
* {{flag|Canada}} â [[Canadian Foreign Affairs Minister]] [[Lawrence Cannon]] said that Egypt remains an [[Canada-Egypt relations|important partner]] for Canada and urged "the Egyptian government to ensure full freedom of political expression for its citizens." He said the Canadian government "continues to stand by the people of Egypt as they demand democratic reforms and respect for human rights. We urge the Government of Egypt to begin an immediate transition toward serious democratic reform."<ref>(2 February 2011). [http://www.international.gc.ca/media/aff/news-communiques/2011/044.aspx?lang=eng "Minister Cannon Condemns Violence in Egypt"]. Retrieved 2 February 2011.</ref>
  +
* {{flag|Chile}} â A press release from the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Chile)|Chilean Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] declared that it is "permanently following the evolution of the events".<ref>{{clarify|date=February 2011|reason=headline in spanish. at minimum, needs english translation of spanish headline appended in "trans_title" field}} {{cite news|title=Egipto: comunicado de prensa de CancillerÃ­a|url=http://www.minrel.gov.cl/prontus_minrel/site/artic/20110131/pags/20110131091403.php|trans_title=|language=[[Spanish language|Spanish]]|work=[[MINREL]]|accessdate=29 January 2011|date=31 January 2011}}</ref>
* {{flag|Colombia}} â [[President of Colombia|Colombian President]] [[Juan Manuel Santos]] asked Mubarak to ensure the situation returns to normal. He said that "[the Colombian people] moves along with the Egyptian people in search of their welfare, freedom and plain use of their human rights and trusts that Mubarak and his government would promote in a short term the return to calm and the strengthening of the democratic institutions." He told their embassy to be prepared to assist Colombian citizens in Egypt.<ref>{{clarify|date=February 2011|reason=headline in spanish. at minimum, needs english translation of spanish headline appended next to spanish headline}} [[Staff writer]] (31 January 2011). [http://www.eltiempo.com/politica/santos-pide-a-presidente-egipcio-fortalecer-instituciones-democraticas_8809619-4 "Santos pide a presidente egipcio fortalecer instituciones democrÃ¡ticas"] (in [[Spanish language|Spanish]]). ''[[Agence France-Presse]]'' (via ''[[El Tiempo (Colombia)|El Tiempo]]''). Retrieved 1 February 2011.</ref>
* {{flag|Colombia}} â [[President of Colombia|Colombian President]] [[Juan Manuel Santos]] asked Mubarak to ensure the situation returns to normal. He said that "[the Colombian people] moves along with the Egyptian people in search of their welfare, freedom and plain use of their human rights and trusts that Mubarak and his government would promote in a short term the return to calm and the strengthening of the democratic institutions." He told their embassy to be prepared to assist Colombian citizens in Egypt.<ref>{{clarify|date=February 2011|reason=headline in spanish. at minimum, needs english translation of spanish headline appended next to spanish headline}} [[Staff writer]] (31 January 2011). [http://www.eltiempo.com/politica/santos-pide-a-presidente-egipcio-fortalecer-instituciones-democraticas_8809619-4 "Santos pide a presidente egipcio fortalecer instituciones democrÃ¡ticas"] (in [[Spanish language|Spanish]]). ''[[Agence France-Presse]]'' (via ''[[El Tiempo (Colombia)|El Tiempo]]''). Retrieved 1 February 2011.</ref>
* {{flag|Cuba}} â [[Minister of Foreign Affairs (Cuba)|Minister of Foreign Affairs]] [[Bruno RodrÃ­guez Parrilla]] hoped for a positive outcome to the protests as one that "meets the interests of the Egyptian people and nation (''[[sic]]'')."<ref>(3 February 2011). [http://www.cubaminrex.cu/english/Actualidad/2011/enero/Cuba%20rejects.html Cuba Rejects U.S. Meddling in Egypt"]. Foreign Affairs of Cuba. Retrieved 5 February 2011.</ref>
